questions.question_text: An organization is concerned about the security posture of vendors with access to its facilities and systems. The organization wants to implement a vendor review process to ensure the policies implemented by vendors are in line with its own. Which of the following will provide the highest assurance of compliance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
3rd party, kind of like gartner and its quadrants

Selected Answer: C
ChatGPT:
To provide the highest assurance of compliance for vendors accessing an organization's facilities and systems, the organization should consider third-party audits and assessments as part of the vendor review process. These assessments can include various methods, such as:

comments.content: chatGPT is worthless, however the answer is C.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
An independent third-party audit report involves engaging an external organization or auditor with expertise in assessing security practices and compliance. The third-party auditor conducts a thorough evaluation of the vendor's policies, procedures, controls, and practices to determine their compliance with established security standards, regulations, and the organization's requirements.
Answer C
This question was on EXAM

choices.D: Internal and external scans from an approved third-party vulnerability vendor

questions.question_text: A security technician is testing a solution that will prevent outside entities from spoofing the company’s email domain, which is comptia.org. The testing is successful, and the security technician is prepared to fully implement the solution. Which of the following actions should the technician take to accomplish this task?

choices.D: Add TXT @ "v=spfl mx include:_spf.comptia.org +all" to the web server.
choices.B: Add TXT @ "v=spfl mx include:_spf.comptia.org -all" to the email server.
choices.C: Add TXT @ "v=spfl mx include:_spf.comptia.org +all" to the domain controller.
choices.A: Add TXT @ "v=spfl mx include:_spf.comptia.org -all" to the DNS record.

discussion.content: This question was on EXAM

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is option A because adding the SPF record to the DNS record ensures that incoming emails can be validated against the authorized servers, preventing spoofed emails from unauthorized sources.

Options B, C, and D are incorrect because they suggest adding the SPF record to specific servers (email server, domain controller, and web server). While SPF records can be added to individual servers, it is more effective to add the SPF record to the DNS record of the domain, as this applies the validation across all incoming email sources.
Answer A

questions.question_text: A security analyst recently observed evidence of an attack against a company’s web server. The analyst investigated the issue but was unable to find an exploit that adequately explained the observations. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this issue?

choices.D: The security analyst has encountered a polymorphic piece of malware.
choices.A: The security analyst needs updated forensic analysis tools.
choices.B: The security analyst needs more training on threat hunting and research.
choices.C: The security analyst has potentially found a zero-day vulnerability that has been exploited.

discussion.content: On exam

Selected Answer: C
A zero-day vulnerability is a type of vulnerability that is unknown to the software vendor or the security community, and therefore has no patch or fix available. If an attacker has used a zero-day vulnerability, it could explain why the analyst is unable to find an exploit that adequately explains the observations. Therefore, this option is the most likely cause of the issue.
Answer C

Selected Answer: B
Only ingesting data you cannot autogenerate security configurations for ALL of your infrastructure.

Selected Answer: D
D. The manufacturing company can ingest the data and use tools to autogenerate security configurations for all of its infrastructure: This is the most likely utility of the IoC data. The data can be ingested into security tools to improve detection and response capabilities, potentially autogenerating security configurations based on the threat data.
Was on the exam

Selected Answer: D
An Information Sharing and Analysis Center (ISAC) can provide valuable threat intelligence and indicators of compromise (IoCs) that can be used to create signatures and other relevant information about threats related to different industries, to help organizations to enhance their threat detection and response capabilities, and one way to do this is by using the data to automate the generation of security configurations and improve overall cybersecurity.

comments.content: I concur with you, option B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
They say:"The company will receive structured IoC data contributed by other members". Only B matches it. A and C refers to the other members not the company. No company will implement D.

Selected Answer: B
Not A, as A is visibility into instances within the manufacturing company’s corporate network. Cannot do like this, visibility for IoC/Sample is the way
Asnwer A
I vote for D

comments.content: B would be the benefit. Answer is B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
They are asking how will the data be used that the company gets from joining the ISAC. Answer A and C don't explain this, I would say B or if not possibly D

comments.content: Notice it says "other members" in answer A, only it says the manufacturing company A will be the answer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The structured IoC (Indicators of Compromise) data contributed by other members will help the manufacturing company to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities in its corporate network. This information can help the company to take proactive measures to prevent or mitigate any cyber-attacks

questions.question_text: A manufacturing company has joined the information sharing and analysis center for its sector. As a benefit, the company will receive structured IoC data contributed by other members. Which of the following best describes the utility of this data?

choices.A: Other members will have visibility into instances of positive IoC identification within the manufacturing company’s corporate network.
choices.C: Other members will automatically adjust their security postures to defend the manufacturing company’s processes.
choices.B: The manufacturing company will have access to relevant malware samples from all other manufacturing sector members.
choices.D: The manufacturing company can ingest the data and use tools to autogenerate security configurations for all of its infrastructure.

questions.question_text: While reviewing log files, a security analyst uncovers a brute-force attack that is being performed against an external webmail portal. Which of the following would be best to prevent this type of attack from being successful?

choices.C: Alter the lockout policy to ensure users are permanently locked out after five attempts.
choices.D: Leverage password filters to prevent weak passwords on employee accounts from being exploited.
choices.A: Create a new rule in the IDS that triggers an alert on repeated login attempts.
choices.B: Implement MFA on the email portal using out-of-band code delivery.
choices.E: Configure a WAF with brute-force protection rules in block mode.

discussion.content:
Greeting my fellow aspiring CySA+ personnel! Although the current highest vote is marked as C, you should notice that C indicates that it will lock the person out of the account PERMANENTLY after 5 failed attempts. What if I wanted to lock the CEO out of his email account? All I would have to do is fail to login to his account 5 times and boom im locked out, but he is also locked out. See the problem that could arise here? All a person would have to do to lock everyone out of their accounts would be to spam the enter key 5 times and the account is permanently locked. Just use MFA. That way whether they know the password or not is irrelevant. That would need the out-of-band PIN or pass to log in as well.
Answer? B

Selected Answer: C
I would go with C. If you get to the MFA part you know that the username and password are correct, so you can still get valuable info out of your attempt to brute force.

Selected Answer: C
You cannot permanently lock a user. What kind of policy is this? 
Temporary locks are used never permanent.

Selected Answer: B
MFA is the best solution here, if the brute-force attack is successful in three tries then Option C will not be considered. B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B sound prefect.
To prevent a brute-force attack on an external webmail portal use MFA.

Selected Answer: B
I go with B, MFA with push notifications when it comes to dealing with brute force attacks.

Selected Answer: B
Out-of-band passcodes can be delivered in a variety of ways to mobile devices: Push notifications – Push notifications deliver an authentication code or OTP one-time passcode through a notification that appears on the lock screen of a customer's mobile device.
So I will go with B.
C and D are wrong because they are blocking the victim.
Go with E. To prevent a brute-force attack on an external webmail portal, configuring a WAF with brute-force protection rules in block mode would be the most effective measure

comments.content: It still helps to know which ones actually make an appearance.
that is all you keep saying without any further valuable contribution.

discussion.content: This question was on EXAM
I would go with C

Out-of-Band code deliver means for example notification for smartpphone? If yes I concur with the answer.
